intro: Lesquerella lunellii, commonly known as the desert lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and thrives in sandy or rocky soils with low moisture. Lesquerella lunellii is adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems. It is also valued for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its oil-rich seeds.
